Schizoid Personality Disorder 323
Schizoid Personality Disorder
301.20 (F60.1)
A. A pervasive pattern of detachment from social relationships and
a restricted range of expression of emotions in interpersonal set-
tings, beginning by early adulthood and present in a variety of
contexts, as indicated by four (or more) of the following:
1. Neither desires nor enjoys close relationships, including be-
ing part of a family.
2. Almost always chooses solitary activities.
3. Has little, if any, interest in having sexual experiences with
another person.
4. Takes pleasure in few, if any, activities.
5. Lacks close friends or confidants other than first-degree
relatives.
6. Appears indifferent to the praise or criticism of others.
7. Shows emotional coldness, detachment, or flattened affectivity.
